page.title: 04LANGUAGE AND CULTURE IN BACK
page.content: {GAELIC Most of the native population speak Gaelic although incomers and their imitators tend to inhibit its use among the very young. {WHERE GAELIC IS USED Most church services and public meetings are conducted in Gaelic when possible.Conversations between neighbours are in Gaelic.The local radio station has regular Gaelic broadcasts and they are widely listened to. {GAELIC IN NEWSPAPERS The 2 main local newspapers, the "Stornoway Gazette" and "West Highland Free Press" have regular Gaelic articles {MODS} There is also a local Gaelic festival called the mod, where there are competitions for singing and recitals.
